Challenge

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • Challenge.Entity
      • Challenge.Enemy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DumbEnemy, LineEnemy, SmartEnemy, WallEnemy

    abstract class Enemy
extends Entity
    Enemies are movable hazards designed to end the level upon contact with the player. Each enemy has its own unique way of moving to the player. Again this class shouldn't be instantiated, instead, its sub-classes should be.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    George Carpenter, Angelo Balistoy

        Creates an enemy
        Parameters:

        position - the position of the Enemy
        direction - the direction the enemy is set upon creation

        int getDirection()
        Gets the direction.
        Returns:

      • nextDirection

        public abstract int nextDirection(Level level)
        Gets the next direction of enemies.
        Parameters:
        level - The level being used.
        Returns:
        The next direction from 0-3 representing North, East, South, West respectively.

      • move

        public Entity[][] move(Level level,
                       Entity[][] entityGrid)
        Moves the enemy based on a given direction.
        Parameters:
        level - The current level.
        entityGrid - The current entity grid.
        Returns:
        The new entity grid to be used in the next turn.

      • getCells

        boolean[] getCells()
        Gets a list of possible moves for the Enemy
        Returns:
        a list of possible moves, not all are available
